newsitem.title: GERMANY: German shares at record levels, but seen stable.
newsitem.headline: German shares at record levels, but seen stable.

text.p: German shares climbed on Monday to new record highs, but traders said they expected dealings to be range-bound in fairly thin volumes.
The DAX index of 30 blue chip shares opened floor trade above 2,700 points and rose to a new record high at 2,704.74 before slipping to 2,701.36, a gain of 18.08 points.
Dealers said the index was catching up with gains made during Friday afternoon in IBIS electronic trade when the 2,700 level was initially breached on the strength of Wall Street.
"Traders are a bit sceptical about these levels," said one dealer. "We're looking a bit sideways at the moment."
"It looks as if the trading range is going to be pretty tight today, around 2,690 to 2,710," said another trader.
Shares in insurance company Allianz were steady after the company posted results that were generally in line with market expectations.
Utility stocks, including Veba and Viag, firmed as trading interest moved into the sector from chemicals.
"The utilities are in demand. People are switching out of chemicals which had been the high-flyer sector. Chemicals are a little bit more defensive at the higher levels," said one dealer.
